title: Calories in One Donut
meta_description: Discover calories in one donut, including full nutrition breakdown like carbs, fat, protein, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard glazed yeast donut (~60 g), bakery-style, fried in oil, with basic glaze; no fillings or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type (yeast vs. cake), brand, size, frying method, and toppings. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One standard glazed donut contains about 250 kcal, mostly from carbs and fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Chocolate frosted topping instead of glaze

faqs.q: How many calories in one glazed donut?
faqs.a: Approximately 250 kcal for a standard 60 g glazed yeast donut.

faqs.q: What are the macros for one donut?
faqs.a: About 28 g carbs, 14 g fat, 3 g protein, and 14 g sugars.

faqs.q: Do donuts have a lot of sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, one donut typically has 14 g of sugars from the glaze and dough.

faqs.q: How does donut size affect calories?
faqs.a: Larger donuts (e.g., 80 g) can have 300+ kcal; mini versions around 100 kcal.
Baked or air-fried versions reduce calories by 50-100 kcal compared to fried.
